intro: Trillium grandiflorum f. elongatum, commonly known as the elongated white trillium, is a rare and striking variant of the white trillium. It is characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves and a single, showy white flower with three petals and three sepals. This plant is native to the eastern United States and thrives in rich, moist woodlands. It is a perennial herb that typically blooms in early spring. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is often protected and requires careful conservation efforts.
